## Commit Type Examples

```
feat: add new streaming feature           â†’ MINOR bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 1.0.0 â†’ 1.1.0
â””â”€ New feature added

fix: resolve timeout in API calls         â†’ PATCH bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 1.1.0 â†’ 1.1.1
â””â”€ Bug fixed

docs: update installation guide            â†’ PATCH bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 1.1.1 â†’ 1.1.2
â””â”€ Documentation updated

feat!: change client initialization       â†’ MAJOR bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 1.1.2 â†’ 2.0.0
â””â”€ Breaking change (! indicator)

refactor: simplify error handling          â†’ PATCH bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 2.0.0 â†’ 2.0.1
â””â”€ Code refactored

feat: add feature with breaking change     â†’ MAJOR bump
â”œâ”€ Version: 2.0.1 â†’ 3.0.0
â””â”€ Body contains: BREAKING CHANGE: ...
```

## Multiple Commits Example

```
Last Release: v1.5.0

Commits since last release:
1. docs: update README
2. fix: resolve memory leak
3. feat: add caching support
4. chore: update dependencies

Decision: MINOR bump (because of "feat:")
New Version: v1.6.0

If any commit had BREAKING CHANGE:
New Version: v2.0.0 (MAJOR)
```
